item.title: Experts in Design of Agriculture (particularly vegetable production) Initiatives – SE Asia context
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
New Zealand is currently implementing an activity in Binh Dinh Province, Viet Nam, aimed at linking poor rural households to markets. One objective of this current activity is to increase the volume of certified safe vegetables supplied to local markets and to markets outside Binh Dinh in order to improve economic returns to farmers and to safeguard human and environmental health in the Province. It has become evident that the ability of farmers to comply with the current certification process (VietGAP) presents challenges and a new approach to vegetable production, post-harvest handling and marketing could be useful.

This assignment will be completed in two phases: Phase One is to undertake field work and in-country consultation to design the Activity, based on the terms of reference and produce an Activity Design Document (ADD).

Proceeding to Phase Two will be at the sole discretion of MFAT. Should it proceed, implementation of the activity will begin in the second quarter of 2015.
